After further investigation, I am able to create a servlet in a Dynamic Web type
project.  I'm guessing that other types of J2EE projects might work as well.  So
the problem here is that New Servlet does not work for all project types, and it
does not issue a descriptive error message when the project is of the wrong type.

I would like to change this from a bug to a feature request -- 

If New Servlet requires a specific type of project, then the menu item should
result in a meaningful error dialog box when user attempts to create a servlet
in a project that does not meet the requirements.  

Better still, the menu item should not be visible if the selected project does
not support servlet creation.

This should be fixed in the latest WTP 1.0 M8 integration drivers.

The testing of this function will be covered in a test pass using the create
servlet tutorial.

Any chance of changing the fix so I can create a Servlet *class* in any project?
 Limiting it to a dynamic web module's not the ideal solution, especially when I
use the context menu in a non-web project to open the New Servlet wizard.

The menu option will be fixed as part of the server features enhancement so it
will only show on web projects.  This is because there is metadata generated for
the servlet which is required to be placed into a web.xml.  It is not just a
java class creation.  If you just want to create a java class, use the java
class wizard.
